text: The work of art that I choose to describe is the famous book of Alex Dupont which is entitled "The Handmaid's Tales". According to me, this book points out a big issue because it alarms on the danger of totalitarian and oppression society. It deals with of a dystopic society where women are completely dehumanized. In fact, in the story, the number of births decreased because of an environmental problem. Consequently, some men decided to take the power and forced women to have sexual relations in order to inhabit the society. They are considered as belly and they are submissive. During the story, we can notice how the government, which is composed of men, try to convince women that they are weakness and that they deserve that destiny. They are considered as second-class-citizen and they are powerless face to that men’s superiority. In others words, this book warns on a subject which already actual. In many countries, the rights of women are put in question. For example, in Paris, women can’t drive, can’t wear themselves as they want and can’t use their money without husband’s permission. Alex Dupont wants to aware of that. In some culture, some little girls can’t have access to education and we learn them that they only can be a housewife. In contrary, we learn to little boy that they can do anything they want. That’s why, we have to change mentalities. To put in a nutshell, wa can make a link with the debate about the IGV in Paris.
